Class PathFinder

java.lang.Object
simulator.util.PathFinder
public class PathFinder extends Object
The PathFinder class can be used by animals to generate paths between two points. This could for example be a rabbit trying to find the shortest route to its own rabbit hole when it turns night.

  • Constructor Details

    • PathFinder

      public PathFinder(Location currentLocation)
      PathFinder constructor
      Parameters:
      currentLocation - - starting point from which path finding will be made from. May be null if location is later set with setLocation()

  • Method Details

    • findPathToLocation

      public boolean findPathToLocation(Location goal, World world)
      Wrapper around findPath() method. Used to find path to specific location on map
      Parameters:
      goal - - The goal location that you're looking to find a route to
      world - - Reference to the world
      Returns:
      whether if a path was found or not

    • findPathToNearest

      public <T> boolean findPathToNearest(Class<T> type, World world)
      Wrapper around findPath() method. Used to find path to specific instance of something
      Parameters:
      type - - The type of object you're looking to find the closest route to
      world - - Reference to the world
      Returns:
      whether if a path was found or not

    • isPathStillValid

      public boolean isPathStillValid(World world)
      Valdiates that the entire route is not obstructed. Note that this can drastically change as other animals step in and out of the path. Therefore, it is not worth file re-generating a new path simply because this returns false, as the path can quickly become valid again after a single time step.
      Parameters:
      world - - Reference to the world
      Returns:
      whether if the entire path is not obstructed

    • hasPath

      public boolean hasPath()
      Checks whether if the current path isn't empty
      Returns:
      if the path is not empty

    • fixObstructedPath

      public boolean fixObstructedPath(World world)

    • getPath

      public Queue<Location> getPath()
      Returns the current path created by the path finder as a queue
      Returns:
      the current path as queue

    • setLocation

      public void setLocation(Location location)
      Sets the current location of the PathFinder. The current location is used by the path finder as the starting location
      Parameters:
      location - - current location or starting location of path finder

    • isFinalLocationInPath

      public boolean isFinalLocationInPath(Location location)
      Determining if the given location is in fact the final point of the current path
      Parameters:
      location - - The location we want to be the final location
      Returns:
      whether if the location given is the final location

    • getFinalLocationInPath

      public Location getFinalLocationInPath()
      Returns final location in path
      Returns:
      final location in path

    • clearPath

      public void clearPath()
      Simply resets the path and deletes every location in the path
